text: Ro05-4082 (N-methylclonazepam, ID-690) is a benzodiazepine derivative developed in the 1970s. It has sedative and hypnotic properties, and has around the same potency as clonazepam itself. but was never introduced into clinical use. It is a structural isomer of meclonazepam (3-methylclonazepam), and similarly has been sold as a designer drug, first being identified in Sweden in 2017. ==See also== * Clonazolam * Cloniprazepam * Flunitrazepam == References == Category:Pharmacology Category:Nervous system Category:Designer drugs
title: Ro05-4082
